triples.name: Reachability Analysis
triples.relevance: The core problem being solved: computing the set of states reachable by a dynamical system from all initial states.

triples.name: Set Propagation
triples.relevance: The fundamental technique used to iteratively propagate sequences of sets according to system dynamics.

triples.name: Formal Verification
triples.relevance: A primary application domain where reachability analysis is used to verify system properties.

triples.name: Supervisory Control Theory
triples.relevance: A control synthesis approach relevant to the controller synthesis applications mentioned in the paper.

triples.name: Estimation Theory
triples.relevance: A related application domain for reachability analysis in estimation problems.

triples.name: Dynamical System
triples.relevance: The fundamental concept describing systems whose behavior is analyzed through reachability analysis.

triples.name: Hybrid System
triples.relevance: A class of systems that exhibit both continuous and discrete behavior, explicitly addressed in the paper.

triples.name: Linear System
triples.relevance: A specific class of systems for which reachability analysis methods are developed and reviewed.

triples.name: Nonlinear System
triples.relevance: A more complex class of systems for which specialized reachability analysis techniques are presented.
